message.content: This question requires knowledge about watching a solar eclipse safely. Watching a solar eclipse without proper eye protection can cause permanent damage to the eyes. Therefore, it is best to use eye protection, such as solar eclipse glasses or specially designed filters, to view a solar eclipse safely. Option (A) is incorrect because looking directly at the sun during an eclipse without proper eye protection is dangerous. Option (B) is also incorrect because using just a hand as shade is not sufficient to protect the eyes from the harmful rays of the sun during an eclipse. Option (D) is also incorrect because using a telescope without proper solar filters can intensify the sun's rays and cause serious damage to the eyes.

This question requires knowledge about the safety precautions needed when viewing a solar eclipse. Option (A) is incorrect because staring at a solar eclipse without proper eye protection can cause permanent damage to the eyes. Option (B) is also incorrect because using a hand as shade does not provide enough protection from the harmful rays of the sun during an eclipse. Option (D) is incorrect because using a telescope without proper solar filters can also cause damage to the eyes. The correct answer is option (C) because it is recommended to use certified solar viewing glasses or other approved eye protection when watching a solar eclipse to protect the eyes from the intense light of the sun.
